# The 6 Best Apps for Car Maintenance and Tips

By Sarah Chaney

Published May 8, 2022

Keeping up with car maintenance is vital. Why not use an app to keep track of
everything that needs doing?

Readers like you help support MUO. When you make a purchase using links on our
site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Read More.

Owning your own car gives you a feeling of independence, but keeping up all
the required maintenance for that car can be overwhelming. From oil changes to
tire rotations to fluid flushes, there's a lot that goes into maintaining your
vehicle.

Luckily, there are apps out there that can help you manage everything. You
might get maintenance reminders from your local car care center or sometimes
have a sticker inside your windshield with a recommended date for your next
oil change. But having an app that's on your smartphone, which you have with
you every day, keeps you updated with all the important info you need.

So, it's time to check out the six best apps for car maintenance and tips.

##  1\. AUTOsist

Close

The AUTOsist app helps you manage your car with an interface that's easy to
use. When you open the app, you'll see all the cars you've entered in your
virtual garage. With the app's free version, you can only add one vehicle.

If you want to add up to five vehicles, you'll have to pay a one-time fee of
$19.99 for the Pro version; if you want to add more than that, you'll need the
Gold plan, which costs $49.99 per year.

With each vehicle, you can add the type, trim, odometer reading, license plate
number, VIN number, and a nickname for the vehicle for easy organization. You
can also snap a picture of your vehicles so you can quickly identify them.

Selecting a vehicle on the home screen allows you to access service records,
fuel records, trip logs, personal notes, reminders, and more. Adding a new
service, like an oil change, takes about five minutes or less, depending on
how detailed you get. You can add pictures, the odometer reading, which shop
was used, and notes to any service entry.

**Download:** AUTOsist for Android | iOS (Free, in-app purchases available)

##  2\. Fuelly or aCar

Close

The Fuelly app and the aCar app are the exact same app, just on two different
operating systems. If you have an Android phone, you'll download aCar, and if
you use an iPhone, you'll use Fuelly.

The home screen is colorful, bringing a little life to something as mundane as
servicing your car. Similar to AUTOsist, Fuelly lets you keep track of records
related to fuel, service, and trips, as well as write out detailed notes and
set up reminders for yourself.

You can also keep up with any vehicle-related expenses, accidents, vehicle
parts that have been replaced, and even the sale of your car. If there are
services you'll know will be repeated, like oil changes and tire rotations,
you can add them to your Services section. Then, when you need to enter an oil
change service record, you can quickly select Oil Change from your menu.

**Download:** aCar for Android (Free, premium subscription available)

**Download:** Fuelly for iOS (Free, premium subscription available)

##  3\. CARFAX Car Care

Close

CARFAX is a popular service when it comes to purchasing a new car, so most
people are probably familiar with it. What you might not know, however, is
that there's a CARFAX Car Care app that can help you keep track of every
service performed on your car without you even having to lift a finger.

Well, you'll have to enter your car's VIN number to find your car, but after
that, you're golden! Because of how CARFAX naturally works, it pulls all of
your car's service information and displays it for you to see. From there,
it'll recommend when you should get your next oil change or tire rotation,
when your registration needs to be renewed, and more.

There's also a helpful section of the app that helps you estimate costs on
certain repairs. This can help immensely if you're unsure of what things cost
so that you don't get ripped off by an untrustworthy service center.

If you're buying a used car, the CARFAX Car Care app is especially helpful
because it pulls up records based on the VIN number. So even if you don't have
physical records of the work that's been done on a vehicle, you can likely see
a virtual record through CARFAX's system.

**Download:** CARFAX Car Care for Android | iOS (Free)

##  4\. Simply Auto

Close

Simply Auto is another great app to keep your car up-to-date with all
services. Maintaining your car is typically a stressful task, but Simply Auto
makes it, well, simple!

First, you'll need to enter your vehicle, and then you can start keeping
records of everything pertaining to that vehicle. There's a plus sign on the
home screen that makes it easy to add new records. From the home screen, you
can enter new fill-ups, services, expenses, trips, or odometer readings.

To get an overview of all the services and costs related to your vehicle, you
can switch from the Dashboard tab to the Stats & Charts tab. There, you can
see Total Stats, Average Fuel Stats, Trip Stats, and more.

Through the Simply Auto app, you can also use a feature called Auto Trip
Logging. If you enable this, it'll automatically detect vehicle motion and
enter your trips for you. You can track 15 trips for free, or upgrade to the
Platinum plan for $9.99 per year or a one-time fee of $29.99.

**Download:** Simply Auto for Android | iOS (Free, premium subscription
available)

##  5\. Drivvo

Close

When you open Drivvo, you can immediately see an overview of all the previous
dates of service for your vehicle. This is an incredibly helpful way to keep
track of when you last took your car in for an oil change or how long ago you
got your tires changed.

Tapping the plus sign at the bottom of the screen allows you to enter records
of income, service, expenses, refueling, routes traveled, and reminders for
the future. When entering a new service record, there's a long list of service
types already preloaded in the app, making the process even easier.

On the reports tab, you can see an overview of collected information and
charts that represent your data. There are general reports and reports
specific to refueling, expenses, income, and services.

**Download:** Drivvo for Android | iOS (Free, premium subscription available)

##  6\. myEZ Car Care

Close

The myEZ Car Care app has a simple interface that may look outdated, but it
functions well and makes it easy to keep track of your car's maintenance
needs. Certain features of the app are locked behind a VIP subscription plan
starting at $9.99 per year. But the majority of the features are available to
use for free!

Every time you take your car in for an oil change, a fluid flush, new brake
pads, or anything else, you can enter it as a new record. You can also set
reminders for yourself to get push notifications on your phone every time you
need to take your car in.

Then, if you enter information when you fuel your car up at the gas station,
the app can automatically calculate your gas mileage for you. Staying up to
date with your car's gas mileage is one of the best ways to make sure you're
not wasting money on gas. And if you're after more ways to save money, there
are apps out there dedicated to helping you be thrifty and save money on your
car's expenses.

**Download:** myEZ Car Care for Android | iOS (Free, premium subscription
available)​​​​​​​

##  Taking Care of Your Car Has Never Been Easier

As a car owner, there's a lot involved in properly maintaining your car. Just
like with your own body, you have to make sure that you're getting regular
checkups, fueling up with the best stuff, and mending things when they're
broken or failing.

Having an app that you regularly use on your smartphone makes having and
maintaining a vehicle much easier. You don't have to worry about going through
paper records in your filing cabinet because everything is right there on your
phone!
